author: Kristian Winfield
title: James Harden won't leave Russell Westbrook's side before All-Star Game
text:
Westbrook’s got at least one person in his corner.
Russell Westbrook and Kevin Durant didn’t sit with each other during the Western Conference All-Star photoshoot before the 2017 NBA All-Star Game . Instead, Westbrook sat with James Harden, who maintains good standing with Thunder guard despite playing on separate teams.
The 2017 Western Conference #NBAAllStar Team! pic.twitter.com/f27m7Gr71d 
— NBA (@NBA) February 20, 2017 In a video posted by RealGM, you can see Westbrook chatting with Harden while Durant stands in the far corner, toying with a basketball. 
You also see Stephen Curry rocking a headband like his brother, Seth Curry .
Russell Westbrook and Kevin Durant on opposite sides of the Western Conference team photo. pic.twitter.com/CsaIqaI4oN 
— RealGM (@RealGM) February 20, 2017 Later during pregame warmups, Westbrook separated himself from the rest of the West All-Stars to get shots up on his own. The West features Durant, as well as three other Warriors All-Stars including Curry, Draymond Green and Klay Thompson .
Russell Westbrook shooting on his own basket during warmups. https://t.co/3ImhO7OFjq pic.twitter.com/TFDrbPpQmQ 
— Ramona Shelburne (@ramonashelburne) February 20, 2017 But moments later, his friend and former teammate Harden came over to shoot with him.
Russell Westbrook was practicing away from Kevin Durant and the other West All-Stars so James Harden joined him. pic.twitter.com/R095TCqEnV 
— Arash Markazi (@ArashMarkazi) February 20, 2017 Westbrook and Durant haven’t gotten along ever since the former Most Valuable Player jetted from Oklahoma City to the Golden State Warriors during free agency over the summer. And their relationship his rock bottom when Durant made his return to Oklahoma City in a Warriors jersey, leading up to the two jawing with one another and Thunder guard André Roberson butting heads with his former teammate.
But their division has brought Westbrook closer with Harden, whom Oklahoma City traded to the Houston Rockets years ago. And though Russ might not get along with the other Warriors’ All-Stars, he’s at least got one player in his corner.
